intro: Oxydectes tamberlikii, commonly known as the Kashmiri bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Oxydectes tamberlikii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
